topItems: Public comment period on board appointment process
Board deliberation and potential appointment vote
keyDecisions: Candidate interviews conducted for Position 2 vacancy
summary: A Special Meeting was held on February 20, 2026 dedicated to interviewing candidates for the vacant Board Position 2. The board heard from applicants and deliberated on the appointment.

topItems: Budget Committee Work Session — 2026-27 deficit review
Enrollment trends and State School Fund projections
summary: The February 12 Budget Committee Work Session focused on the district's projected $10.4M deficit for 2026-27, with leadership presenting enrollment-driven funding concerns and preliminary budget reduction scenarios.

topItems: Lane ESD Local Service Plan presentation
Native American Student Union Summit update (Feb 19)
Consent agenda — minutes approval and routine items
summary: The February 10 Regular Meeting included a Lane ESD Local Service Plan presentation, updates on the NASU Summit and Future Colts program, and routine board business.

topItems: Board goals review and mid-year progress
summary: The January 27 Work Session focused on reviewing board goals, discussing the superintendent evaluation process, and previewing the 2026-27 budget development timeline.

topItems: First reading — policy updates (OSBA model policies)
Public comment — community concerns on programs
Consent agenda — December minutes, financial reports
summary: The January 13 Regular Meeting included the superintendent's enrollment report, first readings of updated OSBA model policies, appointment of Budget Committee community members, and public comment.

topItems: Second reading and adoption of policy updates
summary: The December 8 Regular Meeting featured the annual audit report, adoption of revised board policies, a special education program update, and student recognition.
The November 17 Work Session covered facilities planning, long-range capital improvements, school safety protocols, and a technology infrastructure assessment across the district.
The November 10 Regular Meeting included updates on HQIM curriculum adoption, the Pathways Program, first readings of board policies, and routine business.
The October 27 Work Session focused on student achievement data, graduation rates, English learner program effectiveness, and social-emotional learning initiatives.
The October 13 Regular Meeting covered personnel updates, the first official student count enrollment report, and routine board business.
The September 22 Work Session featured the superintendent's back-to-school report covering all 21 schools, transportation updates, and initial enrollment projections.
The September 8 Regular Meeting opened the 2025-26 school year with the superintendent's report, a budget update on beginning fund balance, OSBA membership renewal, and committee assignments.
